relation: Between 4 to 5 years. No knowledge of Marathi required.
Between 5 to 7 years. No knowledge of Marathi required.
At least 7 years old. (This class will be divided into two - one for students under 10 and another for 10 and above.) Must understand Marathi conversation. Be able to construct simple sentences.
At least 7 years old. Must understand Marathi conversation. Be able to speak 5-10 simple sentences about a day-to-day discussion topic. Be able to read and write simple passages.

At least 10 years old. Must understand Marathi conversation. Be able to speak 5-10 simple sentences about a day-to-day discussion topic. Be able to read and write simple passages. Must have completed the Marathi Dusari course or equivalent.

Be able to tell their name and their parents names in full sentences. Be able to understand simple stories. Be able to sing songs in a group. Be able to participate in simple group activities and games involving Marathi words and conversations.

Learn 150 vocabulary words used every day. Be able to construct simple sentences using vocabulary words. Be able to describe oneself and one's family in 5 sentences. Be able to tell simple stories. Be able to sing poems/songs. Be able to participate in group activities and games involving Marathi words and conversations. Introduction to Marathi letters. Not necessary to be able to write them all.

Learn 150 site and vocabulary words (over and above the words for K). Be able to construct simple sentences using vocabulary words. Introduction to Marathi pronunciation and diction. Be able to talk about a topic of interest in about 10 sentences. Be able to tell simple stories. Be able to recite poems. Be able to participate in group activities and games involving Marathi words and conversations. Be able to read and write simple passages. Expected level of difficulty is Bal-Bharati Grade 1 book. Introduction to Marathi grammar. Use of gender, singular/plural and tense.

Learn 150 vocabulary words (over and above the words for grade 1). Be able to construct sentences using vocabulary words. Fluent in Marathi pronunciation. Be able to talk extempore about a topic of interest in about 20 sentences. Be able to recite poems. Be able to debate for and against a topic. Be able to participate in group activities and games involving Marathi words and conversations. Be able to read and write passages. Expected level of difficulty is Bal-Bharati Grade 2 book. Further understanding of Marathi grammar. Understand pratyaya, introduction to diction, root words etc.

Learn 200 vocabulary words (over and above the words for grade 2). Be able to construct sentences using vocabulary words. Fluent in Marathi pronunciation. Be able to talk extempore about a topic of interest in about 20 sentences. Be able to recite poems. Be able to debate for and against a topic. Be able to participate in group activities and games involving Marathi words and conversations. Be able to read and write passages. Expected level of difficulty is Bal-Bharati Grade 3 book. Further understanding of Marathi grammar.
